summary:
As a Product Manager at Telus Health, I am dedicated to improving wellbeing by developing innovative solutions that make a difference in people's lives. My focus is on building products that address substance use, alcohol addiction, responsible gambling, and sportsbetting.

With my PhD in Neuromodulation and experience as a research scientist, I bring a unique perspective to product development. I excel at analyzing complex data, formulating and testing hypotheses, and identifying connections. My expertise in project design, data interpretation, and research tool implementation make me well-equipped to drive product initiatives forward.

I am a collaborative team player and thrive in environments that encourage breakthrough thinking and high-level objectives. I am also an effective communicator and understand the importance of effectively communicating conclusions and recommendations in order to drive adoption. My public speaking skills are sharp, as I am a 5-year member of Toastmasters and have achieved the highest award, Distinguished Toastmaster (DTM).

In addition to my role at Telus Health, I am a Harvard-MIT Case Competition and IXL Center Innovation Olympics winner. My passion for healthcare and commitment to improving people's lives extend beyond work, as I have also created a supportive community for students seeking careers in Biomedical Engineering through my website, biomedikal.in, and social media channels.

My fields of interest include product management, data analysis, management consulting, and medical device research and development. I welcome opportunities to collaborate and make a positive impact in the healthcare industry.

Experienced in
Agile Methodologies
Business Analysis
SQL
User Experience (UX)

projects.description: Developed an integrated system comprising of DTMF technology, ECG systems & Microcontroller 8051 technologies for remotely monitoring the patient parameters like ECG in a real-time manner so that physician can advise suitable treatment to the patient.
projects.title: Realtime Remote Patient Monitoring system

projects.description:
Measurement of temperature using temperature sensor LM 335 then the measured data was transmitted to the microcontroller
after digitizing it using ADC, and then it was displayed on a LCD display.
projects.title: Temperature measurement system using LM 335 & microcontroller 8051

projects.description:
Guided a student in her project in L.D College of Engineering, Ahemdabad
it was related to controlling the mouse by the signals from the eyes
projects.title: Mouse Control Via EOG

projects.description:
This project involved acquisition of
ECG from the body using three limb leads then processing the data using the conventional electronic circuitry comprising of
filters & instrumentation amplifiers, then the data was transmitted through serial port communication to a wireless transmitter
and then this transmitted data was read by the receiver interfaced with the computer system and ECG was displayed on the
screen.
projects.title: Wireless ECG using three leads.

projects.description:
In this project Dual Tone
Multiple Frequency technology used in the keypad of the telephone set was utilized, the home appliances or robot can be
controlled through just a phone call, thus making the life easy.
projects.title: DTMF based home appliance & robot control.

projects.description:
Understanding an studying the current guidelines for taking disciplinary actions against the students. Analysing the scope and impact of guidelines leading to punishment by Hostel disciplinary committee at an institute level.
Policy impacts the 7000 hostel residents of IIT Madras.
Introduced a unique reprimand system where every type of breach in hostel rules accounts for a special punishment.
projects.title: Policy drafting for Hostel Disciplinary Committee Regulations

projects.description: Drafting a policy to regulating the unauthorized entry of vehicles in IIT Madras. Understanding the vehicle movement in the campus which clocks to around 2500 vehicles per day. Drafting suitable measures to curb the menace and provide the recommendations to the administration to work upon. This is still undergoing
projects.title: Policy drafting for regulating the vehicles movement in IIT Madras owing to higher pollution and noise levels

projects.description:
Students of premier institutes are undergoing lot of mental stress these days and they take misfortunate steps at times.
A subcommittee was formed to analysed the effort of institute to prevent such mishappenings by the student parliament. Work of this project involved understanding and analysing the existing measures to tackle issues with mental being and suggest policies to improve the overall mental health of the students in the institute. 
The work regarding this is still going on and requires a lot of research, analyzing the data of different premier institute as well.
projects.title: Policy drafting for the mental well being of students in premier institution like IIT Madras

projects.description:
Creating and establishing guidelines for the student bodies which come under the student parliament.
This involved meeting all the student secretaries responsible for the different student bodies which are operational under them.
These guidelines will be in effect soon and have been passed in student parliament without any opposition. 
These guidelines have provided a framework for the operation as well as starting of a student body under student parliament
projects.title: Policy drafting for the student bodies under student parliament

projects.description: IJBSE launched in March 2014 by the Education and Healthcare Foundation of India, is a quarterly peer-reviewed journal devoted to publishing the highest quality innovative papers in the fields of bioengineering. The typical focus of the journal is to report applications of novel scientific and technological breakthroughs, as well as technological subjects that are still in the proof-of-concept stage. IJBSE provides a forum fador case studies and practical concepts of bioengineering.
projects.title: International Journal of Bioscience and Engineering

publications.description: Biomedical Engineering is a field which is very interdisciplinary in nature. Anything you do for improving healthcare in any field of engineering, it  becomes a part of Biomedical Engineering.
publications.name: Sky is the Limit for Biomedical Engineers

publications.description: Ultrasound offers non-invasive solutions to different kinds of pathological measurements inside the body. One of the important but not so popular applications of ultrasound is in measuring the intracranial pressure (ICP) inside the brain. It provides a non-invasive solution for the measuring of intracranial pressure, which is generally done by making an incision in the cranium. The main application is fast and non-invasive diagnosis of the brain injury during the first ‘Golden Hour’ after casualty.
publications.name: Intracranial Pressure & Ultrasound
“Development of an Intracranial Pressure Monitoring System,”
publications.description: As part of the indigenous development of the first prototype of an intracranial pressure monitoring system, three aspects were pursued and they are presented in this paper. The first is the fabrication of the piezoresistive pressure sensor die; the second is the signal conditioning and electronic integration, and the third is packaging. The methods used in this work are not new; the goal was to investigate the feasibility of making a device that could be produced at affordable cost for the Indian market. No cost analysis is carried out in this paper but most of the work is done with what is available in India. The main challenge faced in this work was in affixing the wires onto the sensor die. The packaged sensor capsule has a diameter of 2  mm and length of 10 mm. One prototype sensor, which was tested, has a sensitivity of 8 mV/V/mm of Hg of pressure, which meets the requirement of resolving 1 mm of Hg. The sensor is also capable of measuring the temperature and compensating for variations due to it.
publications.publisher: 5th ISSS National Conference on MEMS, Smart Materials, Structures andSystems

publications.description: In India, obesity is increasing at an alarming rate especially in urban areas. Obesity primarily increases the risks for coronary heart diseases,calculi in liver and gall bladder and reproductive health diseases. These diseases are diagnostically confirmed with the help of ultrasound imaging. This mode of imaging has been predominantly used in quantifying and qualifying the diseases associated with human soft tissues. However, the effectiveness of imaging by ultrasound depends largely on the body fat content. Large deposits of fat below the subcutaneous layer in obese people attenuate the ultrasound waves. This results in reduced penetration of ultrasound into the body, thereby affects the quality of the image. Thus the image taken up by the ultrasound device in obese patient is not of good resolution and doesn't provide enough details to give a substantial diagnosis. This is a potential hazard which may even lead to wrong diagnosis or failure of early detection. So, the obese patients are advised to go for expensive and riskier imaging modalities even when it is not really required. Moreover, obese patients need specially sized MRI, CT gantry which will suit them. But, it is not practically possible for all hospitals to buy those expensive imaging devices and they are not available in India as of now. This paper proposes potential improvements in the imaging technique which would help to solve the challenges faced in carrying out ultrasound imaging on obese patients.
publications.name: Significance and Advancement of Ultrasonography in obese people
publications.publisher: 14th Asia Pacific Conference on Non-Destructive testing 2013, Mumbai
